title: Alerts & Analysis on the book & film "How to Blow Up a Pipeline"

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any alerts or critical infrastructure guidance (documents, memorandum, correspondences, or bulletins) relating to the 2023 fictional film or 2021 book, “How to Blow Up a Pipeline," including, but not limited to the April 6, 2023  bulletin from the FBI’s Weapons of Mass Destruction Directorate as reported by Rolling Stone (https://www.rollingstone.com/politics/politics-news/pipeline-movie-fbi-terrorism-hollywood-1234717269/).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rebecca Williams

title: Center for Naval Analyses - Implicit Bias Training

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Center for Naval Analyses - Implicit Bias Training
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Any and all written records (including but not limited to hard-copy documents, memos, emails, word processor documents, PDF documents, PowerPoint files, etc.) regarding the Managing Bias Training pilot program held in January of 2023 in partnership with  the Park Ridge police department & the Center for Naval Analyses. Please include 

-emails between the Des Plaines police department and the Center for Naval Analyses, the Park Ridge police department, and any community members. Please include any email attachments.
-any training materials used during the event, including PowerPoint slides, handouts, and other materials provided to attendees.
-names of training attendees.
-any reports or evaluations produced as a result of the training event, including any feedback or assessment provided by participants/facilitators.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Northwestside Coalition
